culture.text: With its historical buildings and imposing city gates Bruges belongs to Unesco World Heritage site. Numerous museums and exhibitions fill the culture finder. This year, from May to October, you can visit the "art triennial Bruges" where 13 artists and architects exhibit their monumental works on and around the canals. The theme of this triennial 2021 : "TraumA"
culture.title: Culture

gastronomy.text:
Fine dining is part of our culture of Burgundy. You’ll find in Bruges dining options of fries tent to Michelin-star restaurants.

We like to let our guests enjoy our “favorites” and help with reservations when needed.
gastronomy.title: Gastronomy

relax.text:
A romantic stroll along the illuminated fairy-tale like Canals, a tasty beer in a pub or a frivolous festival on the beautiful squares, put you in the perfect holiday mood.
Belgian chocolate and waffles make your holiday perfect ! We give our guests all suggestions.
relax.title: Relax Bruges

sportsAndNature.text:
Around the city there are important green footpaths and nature reserves, so there is a possibility to safely ride your bike on the cycle lanes around the city.
You can also reach the coast , the nature reserve ‘het Zwin’ and the polders near Uitkerke by bike, while visiting colourful polder villages.
The old fortified town of Sluis (NL) is barely 20 km away.
The book village of Damme is even within walking distance.
We provide cycling and walking maps and give our guests the best and adapted suggestions, also for unique pick-nick places, lovely quiet evening walks,...
sportsAndNature.title: Sports and nature

access.bus: By bus : At the train station, exit “Centrum”, take BUS 2 on platform A1.
access.car: By car : Loading and unloading is allowed in front of our house. We’ll help you to find parking space.
access.title: Access

HEADER.subtitle: Your Favorite Cosy and Quiet Bed and Breakfast in BRUGES

booking.item2: Balance : payment on arrival using cash or credit card, or in advance by bank transfer
booking.item3: Cancelling is possible without penalty up to 10 days before the arrival date. For later cancellation, the first night and possibly ordered breakfast is charged. In case of no show, the total sum of the reservation will be charged.
booking.text:
Deposit of 1 night is required as a reservation.
Balance payment in cash on arrival. We accept credit cards.
booking.title: Booking

extraInfo.title: Extra info

room1.text: The spacious guest room with comfortable boxspringbed (1.80 m) is located on the 2th floor. You have a modern and warmly decorated bathroom with walk-in shower, toilet and wash basin. There is a hairdryer and free Wi-Fi.
room1.title: Cosy and quiet 2 person room

room2.text: The spacious guest room with comfortable boxspringbed (1.80 m) is located on the 2th floor. You have a modern and warmly decorated bathroom with walk-in shower, toilet and wash basin. There is a hairdryer and free Wi-Fi. Cozy corner with chair and table.
room2.title: Cosy and quiet 2 person room

room3.text: The spacious guest room with comfortable boxspringbed (1.80 m) is located on the 2th floor. You have a modern and warmly decorated bathroom with walk-in shower, toilet and wash basin. There is a hairdryer and free Wi-Fi.
room3.title: Cosy and quiet 2 person room

hosts.text:
As born and raised locals we know our city and we like to share this with our guests. Still we discover some romantic places, tasty restaurants and cosy pubs.
We advise you about all kinds of activities : Cycling and walking tours in and around the city, to the sea, in the polders, romantic walks in the city, events...
hosts.title: Hosts

house.text:
The guests have their own room and bathroom. Breakfast is served in the dining room or outside in our sunny and flowered garden.
Our chickens don’t like other pets, only our dear dog and he, yes he loves our guests.
Smoking is allowed in the garden.
house.title: Our house

neighbourhood.text:
We gladly welcome you in our 3 guestrooms, situated in the quiet and green Saint Ann district, a popular working-class area within the old city walls of Bruges.
Via a 10-minute walk along picturesque small streets you will arrive at the city centre, from where you can enjoy numerous historic buildings, events, museums, festivals, exhibitions…
3 km further on, on foot or by bike, you reach the green surroundings of the city, which extend down to the sea.
neighbourhood.title: Our neighborhood
